attributes.additional_details:
Following the flooding in the UK in 2013/14 we call upon the government to:

1. Disband the Enviornmental agency and return its authority to a pre-1996 structure of devolved regional responsibility

2. To give those devolved agencies adequate resources to recommence dredging of the rivers in force

3. To scope each of those agencies with a priority of flood defence above bio diversity, environmental protection and conservation.

4, To make those regional agencies accountable to local people either at district or borough level.
